title: Djokovic rallies at US Open to stay unbeaten
description: Something unusual happened to Novak Djokovic at the US Open on Wednesday. He lost a tiebreak.

title: Trump silent as world leaders call for answers from Putin on Navalny poisoning
description: The Trump administration remained largely silent Wednesday as leaders around the world expressed concern and demanded answers from Russian President Vladimir Putin's government over the revelation that a leading opposition figure had been poisoned by a Soviet-era chemical nerve agent.

title: Though Jacob Blake's health is progressing, his family says national reform is not
description: More than a week after Jacob Blake was shot, his family said his life is no longer in danger -- but still so few of their questions have been answered.

title: US sanctions International Criminal Court officials to try to deter war crimes probe
description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Wednesday announced sanctions against two International Criminal Court officials -- the Trump administration's most aggressive move yet to try to deter an ICC investigation into possible war crimes by US military and intelligence officials.

title: John Boyega calls Disney out for marketing a Black character, only to ultimately push them aside
description: When Disney first revealed John Boyega as a stormtrooper in "The Force Awakens," he immediately became the target of racist comments from "Star Wars" fans protesting the casting of a Black person in the role.

title: Pelosi says she was 'set up' by hair salon owner
description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi responds to Republican backlash to her San Francisco hair salon visit, saying she was "set up" by the owner. CNN's Manu Raju reports.

title: Barr's response to Trump's claim stuns CNN reporter
description: Attorney General Bill Barr appeared to support President Trump's unfounded claim that "thugs" on a plane were traveling to the Republican National Convention to do "big damage."

title: Good luck getting answers out of Russia on its latest high-profile poisoning
description: When the German government said Wednesday that Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny had been poisoned by the nerve agent Novichok, one thing was certain: The apparent murder attempt would become a full international crisis.

title: Fact check: The 9 conspiracy theories Trump is currently pushing
description: President Donald Trump has been a conspiracy theorist for years. Perhaps never before, though, has he pushed so many conspiracy theories at one time.

title: Store owner rejects Trump's invite. See who appeared with him instead
description: A store owner in Kenosha, Wisconsin, whose store was destroyed by rioters following the shooting of Jacob Blake explains why he rejected President Trump's invitation to tour the damage. CNN affiliate WTMJ reports.

title: US debt will exceed GDP next year for first time since end of WWII
description: The US debt is projected to exceed the size of the entire country's economy next year, the Congressional Budget Office said Wednesday.

title: Pilots report man flying a jetpack above Los Angeles
description: An unusual call came into the Los Angeles airport concerning an unidentified man flying a jetpack. CNN affiliate KCBS/KCAL has the story.

title: The architectural wonders of Thailand's White Temple
description: There are 33,000 traditional temples in Thailand. But with its majestic, otherworldly exterior, Wat Rong Khun is unlike any other site of worship. From the ghoulish heads that hang from surrounding trees, to the hands that reach for you as you cross the bridge to the main temple, every part of this site is unique. While Wat Rong Khun attracts thousands of tourists from around the world, it received negative attention when it first opened because critics said it wasn't traditional Thai art. Yet the temple continues to stand defiantly as a symbol of Thai art for a modern world.

title: The UK's first Muslim female ref is proving people wrong
description: Football has never been just a hobby for Jawahir Roble; it's her passion.

title: US hits Chinese diplomats with new restrictions
description: US-based senior Chinese diplomats will be required to seek US government permission to engage in a number of routine activities, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced Wednesday -- the latest escalation amid worsening tensions between Washington and Beijing.

title: Comedian-actor accused of exposing himself to multiple women
description: For actress Megan Drust, what happened between her and comedian Chris D'Elia is something she hasn't talked about for nearly a decade.

title: Belgian town finds first mayor's heart hidden in local fountain
description: Locals in a Belgian city have believed for over a century that the heart of their first mayor was hidden within a public fountain.

title: How 11-year-old boy went from dancing barefoot in the streets to viral ballet star
description: In June, 11-year-old ballet dancer Anthony Mmesoma Madu was filmed barefoot, spinning and leaping gracefully in the air and landing in concrete, rain soaked puddles.

title: Pence's laughable response to questions about Trump's hospital visit
description: Vice President Mike Pence was asked Tuesday night about a report from a new book that he had been alerted to be ready to assume the powers of the presidency if Donald Trump had to be anesthetized in an unscheduled trip to Walter Reed hospital last November. Here's what he said:

title: R&B singer Akon is building a 'real-life Wakanda' worth $6 billion in Senegal
description: The award-winning R&B singer Akon is going ahead with ambitious plans to build a "futuristic" city in Senegal that he says will be a real-life version of Wakanda, the hi-tech nation portrayed in Marvel blockbuster "Black Panther."

title: UAE denies knowledge of film hero's arrest
description: The United Arab Emirates has denied any involvement in the arrest of Hotel Rwanda film hero Paul Rusesabagina, saying he left Dubai legally last Friday on a private jet bound for the East African country.

title: Harry and Meghan sign production deal with Netflix
description: First, Netflix had "The Crown." Now it has Harry and Meghan.

title: The stock market thinks Biden is going to beat Trump
description: The presidential election is only two months away and the stock market is soaring.

title: India steps up latest crackdown on Chinese apps
description: India has banned another collection of Chinese apps, including the mobile version of popular game PUBG, as tensions between the two countries rise again over disputed territory along their shared border.

title: Left behind because of Covid-19, a tiny dog travels 10,000 miles to rejoin her owners
description: All the best dogs find their way home eventually. Sometimes, like Pipsqueak the wiener dog, they've got to embark on a journey of more than 10,000 miles to get there.

title: DraftKings shares soar after Michael Jordan becomes an investor and adviser
description: Hall-of-Fame basketball legend Michael Jordan will be an investor and special adviser to the board of sports-betting company DraftKings, the company announced Wednesday.

title: What are nerve agents like Novichok and how do they kill?
description: Novichok, a highly poisonous chemical, was designed by Russia during the Cold War and made to be undetectable by standard detection equipment. CNN explores how it, and other nerve agents, work.

title: Tyler Perry, who was once homeless, is now a billionaire, Forbes says
description: Tyler Perry enjoys how people sometimes explain his success.

title: Former friend and aide explains Melania's 'don't care' jacket
description: Former friend and aide to Melania Trump, Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, discusses the first lady's controversial "I really don't care do you?" jacket that she wore when she went to visit children who had been separated from their parents at the border due to her husband's immigration policies.

title: 2016 Trump voter: This was my 'cross the line' moment
description: CNN's Alisyn Camerota speaks with a panel of six suburban White women that voted for President Donald Trump in 2016 about who they plan to vote for in the upcoming election.

title: Two black holes merged 7 billion years ago. News of it just reached Earth in a historic discovery
Australia enters first recession in three decades
description: The coronavirus pandemic has officially pushed Australia into its first recession in nearly three decades.

title: India and China are squaring off in the Himalayas again. How worried should we be?
description: Two nuclear-armed powers, both run by nationalist governments at a time of economic tension, are once again squaring off along their shared border. Is this a recipe for disaster?

title: 'Game of Thrones' producers to adapt Chinese sci-fi trilogy for Netflix
description: The Chinese science fiction trilogy "The Three-Body Problem" has won awards around the world and been heralded by fans including Barack Obama and sci-fi giant George R. R. Martin.

title: Bubble tea and bears: Taiwanese vote on creative passport designs
description: Voted on by thousands of Taiwanese, the results of a "We are Taiwan" Passport Cover Design Competition are in -- and bubble tea fans won't be impressed.

title: There's a legitimate way to end coronavirus vaccine trials early, Fauci says
description: A COVID-19 vaccine could be available earlier than expected if ongoing clinical trials produce overwhelmingly positive results, said Dr. Anthony Fauci, the nation's top infectious disease official, in an interview Tuesday with KHN.

title: 'Everything he says and does points toward herd immunity,' official says of task force newcomer who has Trump's ear
description: A different approach toward the coronavirus pandemic is taking hold at the White House, as newcomer adviser Dr. Scott Atlas eclipses Dr. Anthony Fauci in influence and President Donald Trump and aides are resigned to the virus' inevitable spread.

title: Sen. Ed Markey defeats a Kennedy in Massachusetts
description: Sen. Ed Markey beat back a bid on Tuesday from Rep. Joe Kennedy, to end his nearly 50 years in elected office for Markey's seat, humbling the Democratic Party's family dynasty that had never before lost an election in Massachusetts.

title: Attorneys for Breonna Taylor's family lash out at prosecutors for referring to her as a 'co-defendant'
description: Attorneys for Breonna Taylor's family lashed out at prosecutors for referring to her as a "co-defendant" in a drug case during plea deal negotiations with Taylor's ex-boyfriend.

title: China is aiming to double the size of its nuclear arsenal, Pentagon report says
description: China is attempting to at least double the number of nuclear warheads in its arsenal in the next decade and its military has already equaled or surpassed the United States in a series of key areas, according to a new Pentagon report released Tuesday.

title: Justice Department hands over latest batch of Mueller witness memos to CNN
description: CNN received on Tuesday night what appears to be the last several hundred pages of witness interview records that the Justice Department is releasing from the Mueller investigation, part of what's become an illuminating monthly disclosure of what witnesses told investigators about Russian election interference and the 2016 campaign.

title: A man flying a jetpack was reported by pilots above Los Angeles
description: An unusual call came into the Los Angeles airport concerning an unidentified man flying a jetpack.

title: How a child with a fractured skull grew up to be the 'world's fastest human calculator'
description: What's 869,463,853 times 73?

title: Anger as cops shoot Black man dead in LA
description: Los Angeles County Sheriff's deputies fatally shot a Black man during a confrontation Monday afternoon in South LA, sparking protests at the scene of the encounter.

title: An Amazon delivery driver saved a drowning dog during his shift
description: To say that John Cassabria is an animal lover is an understatement. He grew up surrounded by pets and is currently the proud owner of four dogs, four cats and even a pet snake.

title: University of California System can't use SAT and ACT tests for admissions, judge rules
description: The University of California system can no longer use ACT and SAT tests as a determinant for admissions, a superior court judge has ruled, handing a victory to students with disabilities.

title: See Mike Pence's response when asked about Trump's hospital visit
description: Vice President Mike Pence said he couldn't recall if he was told to be on standby when President Trump visited Walter Reed hospital in November 2019 as a new book reports.
